content.text:
It's alive! üêô

This is now available in [ssb-schema-definitions](https://github.com/ssbc/ssb-schema-definitions/blob/170c16476421591ce93b7ab0d0333a81da7b6756/index.js#L104-L107) and ssb-[thread](https://github.com/ssbc/ssb-thread-schema/blob/1fdcc35d99bc99acd3cf38ce83677fd47c3577fd/post/reply/schema.js#L18)-[schema](https://github.com/ssbc/ssb-thread-schema/blob/1fdcc35d99bc99acd3cf38ce83677fd47c3577fd/post/root/schema.js#L15), although I *think* we need to add `hasContentWarning()` or similar (?).

[@mix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) 

Thanks for pairing on this with me! After our call I've been spending a few minutes reading [Understanding JSON Schema](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/index.html) and I'm really happy that you chose this spec for codifying our schemas. I'm really pumped to use this more often now that I'm more familiar.

Also when you have a chance I'd love to be able to publish the latest ssb-thread-schema change to npm. I've made [an issue](https://github.com/ssbc/ssb-thread-schema/issues/2) if that's helpful. üëç
